context: Regulations for speed limits in different lanes of an expressway

MTL_expressions.description: Maximum speed should not exceed 120 km/h

MTL_fitness_details.explanation: MTL is suitable for representing time-bound constraints.

propositions.description: Maximum speed is less than or equal to 120 km/h

MTL_expressions.description: Minimum speed should not be lower than 60 km/h

MTL_fitness_details.explanation: MTL efficiently represents lower bound constraints over time.

propositions.description: Minimum speed is greater than or equal to 60 km/h

MTL_expressions.description: Minimum speed for the left lane is 100 km/h if there are two lanes

MTL_fitness_details.explanation: MTL can represent conditions based on lane count.

propositions.description: Minimum speed in left lane is 100 km/h when there are two lanes

MTL_expressions.description: Minimum speeds for different lanes when there are three or more lanes

MTL_fitness_details.explanation: MTL can capture different conditions for multiple lanes.

propositions.description: Minimum speed for the farthest left lane is 110 km/h and for the middle lane is 90 km/h when there are three or more lanes

MTL_expressions.description: Motor vehicles must follow the speed indicated by road signs in case of discrepancies

MTL_fitness_details.explanation: MTL can represent conditional constraints based on discrepancies.

propositions.description: If a discrepancy exists between the sign and the stated limits, follow the sign

non_formalized_parts.description: Specific time frames for speed limit enforcement
non_formalized_parts.reason_for_non_formalization: Lack of explicit time frames in the text

sequence_dependencies.dependency_description: Speed limit adherence depends on road sign indications.

conflicts.description: Potential conflict between general speed limits and specific lane limits
